title: Blitzcranks zoning is too strong.
body:
All game he passively zones anyone from making engages, he has the strongest engage in the game and creates an instant 1v5, his grab is wicked fast and now thanks to the recent buffs his movespeed is Hecarim tier. He can actually run down Hecarim with Righteous glory which is basically what makes him stupidly strong because if he fails his engage with it you can't actually counter engage because of the massive AOE slow so he gets to fail his engages and not actually be punished for it.

He has a stupidly safe harass free lane phase and you can't actually farm because if you stop for a spit second to auto he can grab you with ease and you can't actually harass him or the enemy carry because you need to sit behind minions. Without a strong engage he's impossible to deal with and even with a strong engage and lockdown he's still a better engager and counter-engager.

Hands down needed a nerf from the start, not a buff. Play against a good blitzcrank and tell me otherwise.

hi, umm my friend that title would go to someone like leona or malphite, sej, amumu... glad i could help - ur welcome

Yeah but they actually make themselves vulnerable, blitz just drags you into a 1v5.

Honestly which is worse, being blitz grabbed or being malph ulted?

You could say it's the same but Malphs ult forces you to flash or whatever because it allows them to engage yet at the very least you can counter engage without the whole team having to flash in and/or have gap closers to turn that 1v5 into a 5v5 and even then they are at the disadvantage of having used flashes or simply because even if they do flash and gap close in; whoever got grabbed has basically just eaten 5 rotations of spells and is now unlikely to be able to fight for long if they are not dead within 2 seconds so it's basically going to be a 4v5 shortly after the fantastical scenario of an entire team flashing or gap closing to counter engage.

You can say Malph ult counters someone being grabbed too but then he's missing out on hitting their backline and is basically just making it a 2v5 instead which is honourable but isn't really going to change the outcome much.
